title: Gravel Bar 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: The aromas bring notes of mesquite and fruit leather, seeming a bit dried out, with the palate showing more of the same. It doesn't all work.

title: Guidi 1929 2015 Aurea Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Whiffs of oak, toasted nut and vanilla follow over to the palate, along with mature yellow apple skin and bitter almond notes. Roasted coffee flavors briefly appear before the lean, austere finish.

title: Happy Camper 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Ripe and fairly concentrated fruit aromas and flavors fill out a soft texture with just a touch of tannin in it. The wine has a good dark color, light cedar and mint accents and a touch of sweetness to round the edges.

title: Heron Hill 2016 Ingle Vineyard Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: This single-vineyard Chardonnay sees no time in oak, making it a straightforward sipper with aromas and flavors of red apple and tart pineapple rind. It's light in profile, with a spritely, easygoing feel.

title: Hosmer 2017 Dry Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Cayuga Lake)
description: Vibrant notes of bubblegum, cinnamon and cherry candies carry the nose and palate of this watermelon-hued rosé. It's light in feel, but altogether an enjoyable fruit-driven sip.

title: Les Caves du Commandeur 2017 Ame du Vin Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The Soul of Wine is an important-sounding name for a fruity and friendly rosé. Fruitiness comes from the crisp red-currant flavors as well as the ripe spice and perfumed acidity. Drink now.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose on this bottling is very light with subtle apple and pear aromas. The palate is somewhat flat, with touches of apple, grass and wet stones.

title: Marco Abella 2015 Òlbia White (Priorat)
description: Oxidized stone-fruit aromas blend with vanilla and rubbery notes on this blend of mostly Garnacha Blanca and Viognier. In the mouth, this feels resiny and creamy, and ultimately rather monotone. Vanilla and wood-resin flavors are prominent prior to an oaky finish that's low on fruit.

title: Markowitsch 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)
description: Some reduction clouds the pear fruit on the nose. The palate is light and dry but lacks focus and drive. A little lemon freshness colors the finish.

title: Maryhill 2016 Proprietor's Reserve Oregon Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pale in color, the aromas bring notes of moss, caramel, sweet herb, peppermint, wood spice and strawberry. The flavors are quite light and elegant, lacking the concentration to fully deliver and seeming a little clunky.

title: Moncaro 2017 Le Vele  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This has subdued tropical fruit and yellow wildflower scents. The light-bodied, forward palate offers yellow peach and pineapple flavors, with an almond-inflected finish. Drink soon.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Muscador NV Cépage Muscat Blanc Muscat d'Alexandrie (Vin Mousseux)
description: Produced from Muscat grown in the south of France, this wine has the honeyed character typical of the grape. There's a dry edge to it, giving pepper notes as well as lychee fruit on the finish. Drink now.

title: Ossian 2015 Viticultura Ecológica Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Briny citrus aromas are a bit stale and vie with oak scents. This barrel-aided Verdejo is oily and resiny in feel. Salty apple and corn flavors are a touch oxidized, and on the finish that oxidized character is more amplified, with hints of popcorn and butter.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Paradise Springs 2016 Chardonnay (Virginia)
description: This wine offers a pleasant nose of pineapple, lemon and lees. The palate displays more of the same, with a surprising stony minerality. The acidity and body are harmonious and the finish is long and smooth in notes of wood and butter.

title: Pounamu 2016 Special Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Ripe tropical fruits, bruised apples and blossoms are encased in a distinctive canned green-bean aroma. The apple-tinged palate shows some textural weight, but it's not quite enough to balance the acidity which feels a tad lean and forced.

title: Prophecy 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This deep-colored and full-bodied wine has plenty of oaky spices in the aroma, and equally rich baking-spice flavors that coat the black-cherry and blackberry core. The tannins are light and the texture is smooth.

title: Rio Madre 2017 Garnacha Rosé (Rioja)
description: A hot-pink color and punchy aromas of citrus and red fruits make for a bright opening. In its current youthful state, this feels healthy and medium in body. Primary citrus flavors come with a spicy note of cactus prior to a foxy, lightly green finish.

title: Sparkman 2014 Ruby Leigh Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is principally Merlot (56%) and Cabernet Franc (22%), with the balance equal parts Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon. The aromas bring notes of vanilla, spice, freshly hewn wood and dried coriander, with the barrel influence (only 56% new French) seeming way out front. The flavors are lighter in style, with the oak winning the day.

title: St. Francis 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This is a thick, dense and oaky red wine, with a generosity of tannin and slight whiff of reduction. Reserved in fruit, it traffics more substantially in leathery tobacco and cigar box.

title: Tenuta di Trecciano 2016  Chianti
description: This informal red suggests red fruit and baking spices on the nose. The simple palate offers wild cherry and clove flavors alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.

title: Toi Toi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Ripe, almost confected, peach and tropical fruit notes lead the way in this wine, where grassy green characters take a big back seat. Nevertheless, it's bright and cheerful, with zippy acidity and an easygoing nature.

title: Tom Gore 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: An earthy nutty aroma and savory oak-spice flavors give this medium-bodied wine an emphasis on complexity rather than pure fruitiness. It has caramel and browned-butter flavors and a fairly rich texture.

title: Vermeil 2015 Frediani Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)
description: This wine is thick and seemingly sweet, tasting powerfully ripe and raisiny on the palate, with richly concentrated characteristics of vanilla and chocolate.

title: Wagner 2014 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Creamy strawberry and cherry aromas meet with black pepper and licorice on the nose. Light to medium in weight, with racing acidity and light tannins, the palate is driven by tart currant and cranberry flavors that finish short but clean.

title: Atwater 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)
description: Leaning on the herbal side, this Merlot shows fresh fennel and tobacco on the nose, with a core of red plum. There's some green bitterness on the palate yet a darker plum note offers some counterbalance.

title: Barker's Marque 2017 The Loop Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Thanks perhaps to a wetter, cooler vintage, this is tightly wound, showing vegetal aromas of canned beans and white pepper, along with zesty lemon, grapefruit and canned pineapples. The acidity on the palate is piercing and shrill, overpowering the tropical and citric fruit flavors.

title: Bellante 2015 Mourvèdre (California)
description: The nose on this bottling is fascinating at first, with stewed red currants awash in dill and anise. But the palate is loaded with overly tangy balsamic notes of cooked fig, tangy plums and olives. It's intriguing yet odd.

title: Cana's Feast 2013 Two Rivers Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This blend of Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot comes from various vineyards in the Horse Heaven Hills and Red Mountain. Aromas of raspberry jam, cranberry, tire rubber and cherry are followed by lighter-styled cranberry flavors that show a sense of restraint. Herb and raspberry flavors linger on the finish.

title: Cave de Tain 2017 Première Note Rosé de Syrah (Collines Rhôdaniennes)
description: While the nose of this light-bodied rosé is quite peachy and perfumed, the palate is demure, suggesting mild pear and underripe apricot. Dry and full bodied, it's balanced by fresh acidity and a salty, mineral finish. Drink now.

title: Château Barbanau 2017 La Girafe Verte Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The name “green giraffe” is something of a mystery, however the wine itself is much more open and simple. It has a lightly herbal character as well as plenty of perfumed fruit. Acidity and a touch of spice add to the crispness. Drink now.
